snippet: A cabin built in a Buffalo church basement has been dismantled because much of the building is being transformed into apartments. But the cabin is to be rebuilt.
abstract: Boy Scout troop in Buffalo, NY, have met in scout-built log cabin nestled in basement of  Lafayette Avenue Presbyterian Church for last 85 years; but church leaders dismantle cabin for $7 million rehabilitation that will turn much of space into 23 apartments; church plans to rebuild cabin inside its Community House, but some fear cabin's essence and spirit will be forever lost.
lead_paragraph: A cabin built in a Buffalo church basement has been dismantled because much of the building is being transformed into apartments. But the cabin is to be rebuilt.

headline.seo: Boy Scouts’ Log Cabin in a Buffalo Church Will Be Rebuilt
headline.main: Built in a Church, a Log Cabin Isn’t Near Its End. Scout’s Honor.
headline.print_headline: Built Inside a Church, A Log Cabin Isn’t Near Its End. Scout’s Honor.
